AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The AI used a largely templated, generic closure/update message and added potentially irrelevant instructions (enable logging/reproduce/send logs) despite stating the issue is already fixed and pending release, without providing concrete next steps like version/build numbers or an immediate workaround for disk usage.
evidence: “We are pleased to inform you that our Development Team has successfully addressed the issue... This fix is slated for release next weekend.”
“Should the problem persist after the update, we request that you enable logging and debugging, reproduce the issue, and send us the new set of logs for further investigation.”
“We kindly ask you to update to the latest version once it becomes available and check if the issue has been resolved.”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There is no sign the customer was stuck in repeated AI loops or repeatedly asked for the same information, and the ticket did reach engineering escalation.

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support did not acknowledge or act on the customer’s initial urgency and explicit request to route to Engineering until much later, effectively ignoring the context that the issue was already evidenced by a screenshot and was blocking upgrades.
evidence: “As seen on the screenshot, GFI App Manager agents are piling up in the Exinda var folder... and block Exinda from successful update to the newer version. Please move this ticket to Engineering for fixing.”
Gap before any visible customer-facing action until: “Thank you for contacting the Exinda Support Team. We have escalated this to our Engineering team for review.” (2025-11-30)

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There was a multi-week gap between the customer’s initial report/follow-up and the first substantive support response/escalation, exceeding the 2-day threshold by a wide margin.
evidence: Customer: “Hi team, ... Please move this ticket to Engineering for fixing.” (2025-11-12T15:24:17+00:00)
Support: “We have escalated this to our Engineering team for review.” (2025-11-30T14:53:32+00:00)

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The customer explicitly confirmed closure, and support closed the ticket accordingly; it was not auto-closed while awaiting promised follow-up.
evidence: Customer: “thanks, we can close this ticket”
Support: “Thank you for your update; we are closing this ticket as requested.”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While the issue could impact upgrades via disk space exhaustion, the ticket does not explicitly indicate an outage/SEV1/P1 condition (no 'production down/critical/outage/urgent' signals), so it doesn’t meet the stated detection criteria.
evidence: “...they will occupy too much space and block Exinda from successful update to the newer version.”
